intro: Perezia multiflora var. typica, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. It has lance-shaped leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Perezia multiflora var. typica is relatively low maintenance and can thrive in a variety of garden settings.
